meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of feudalism
meanings.sent1: The feudally structured society had lords and vassals.
meanings.sent2: The castle's architecture was feudally inspired.
meanings.sent3: The knight's armor looked feudally fashionable.
meanings.sent4: The feudal system was deeply ingrained in the feudally governed land.
meanings.sent5: The peasants lived feudally under the rule of the lord.

meanings.definition: in a feudal manner or style
meanings.sent1: The king ruled feudally over his subjects.
meanings.sent2: The serfs worked feudally on the lord's land.
meanings.sent3: The jester danced feudally at the royal banquet.
meanings.sent4: The knights jousted feudally in the tournament.
meanings.sent5: The villagers celebrated feudally during the harvest festival.
